articles.title: DPRK to Start Legal Disposal of S. Side's Real Estates in Mt. Kumgang Resort
articles.content:
DPRK to Start Legal Disposal of S. Side's Real Estates in Mt. Kumgang Resort
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The Guidance Bureau of Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang of the DPRK released the following report now that it has become impossible to hold negotiations with the south side's businessmen due to the south Korean authorities' unjust obstructions. The DPRK set July 29 as a deadline for holding the negotiations.
					 As already opened to public, the DPRK promulgated a law on special zone for international tour of Mt. Kumgang of the DPRK following three-year suspension of the tour of the mountain due to the south Korean authorities. Then it took measures allowing the south Korean businesses to register their businesses and properties again and make up their minds either to take part in international tour or adjust their properties. The DPRK also provided several opportunities for them to hold negotiations with the DPRK.
					
					 This was an expression of sincerity and magnanimity as it was a measure taken as compatriots to protect the property right and interests of the south side's businesses.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, however, obstructed the negotiations between the DPRK and the south side's NGO business groups for the adjustment of properties. A few days ago, they proposed north-south authorities' working talks in a bid to totally elbow out NGOs from the negotiations.
					
					 The DPRK side conveyed its stand that it can hold authorities' working talks on condition that the south side brings NGO groups to the Mt. Kumgang resort and start adjusting properties even though it was well aware of the ulterior aim sought by it.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, however, misled public opinion for no good reason, saying that the DPRK rejected the north-south authorities' working talks. They neither sent NGO groups nor showed up themselves.
					
					 This proves that the "protection of property right" of the south side's businesses touted by the south Korean authorities are empty talks and the proposed authorities' working talks are nothing but a trick to block the adjustment of properties and scotch international tour and the south Koreans' resumption of tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 The DPRK side notified the south side that it would start the legal disposal of the south side's properties according to its law unless the south side responds to the negotiations for the adjustment of the properties by July 29.
					
					 Now that it has become impossible to hold negotiations due to the unreasonable obstructions of the puppet group, the Guidance Bureau declares that it would start the legal disposal of all the real estates and other properties of the south side inside the special zone for international tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 The DPRK notified Hyundai of this decision at Mt. Kumgang resort so that it can be conveyed to the south side's businesses. It also informed the south Korean authorities of the decision through a Panmunjom channel.
					
					 The period of undergoing the procedures for the legal disposal of the south side's businesses' properties is three weeks and those concerned of the south side are obliged to witness the proceedings.
					
					 The disposal period can be extended if necessary so as to offer the south side's businesses the opportunities of taking part in international tour or leasing, transferring and selling their properties.
					
					 Those businesses whose entry into Mt. Kumgang resort is difficult due to the authorities' obstruction can entrust the matter to a third party. They can meet the DPRK side in a third place for the registration and disposal of their properties or can choose other ways.
					
					 Those businesses which failed to take part in the legal disposal of the properties within three weeks shall be considered as having given up their property right and their properties shall be disposed of according to the law on special zone for international tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 Those real estates shall be used for international tour after going through necessary procedures.
					
					 The responsibility for the prevailing situation entirely rests with the south Korean authorities.
					
					 These measures taken by the DPRK fully conform with the DPRK law and the international usage and therefore, the south side has no right to appeal against them.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam　Greets Moroccan King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam　Greets Moroccan King
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, sent a massage of greeting to Mohamed the Sixth, king of Morocco, on Friday on its national holiday.
					 Kim in the message wished steady development and prosperity to Morocco, expressing belief that the friendly relations between two countries would further develop.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho Meets Lao Military Delegation
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho Meets Lao Military Delegation
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Friday met and had a talk with the delegation of the General Staff of the Laotian People's Army led by Chief Sanyahak Phomvihane.

articles.title: Gift from Chief of Lao Army General Staff
articles.content:
Gift from Chief of Lao Army General Staff
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the chief of the General Staff of the Laotian People's Army on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Chief Sanyahak Phomvihane handed it over to Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, on Friday.

articles.title: Lao Military Delegation Departs for Home
articles.content:
Lao Military Delegation Departs for Home
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the General Staff of the Laotian People's Army led by Chief Sanyahak Phomvihane Friday flew back home after visiting the DPRK.
					 During the stay, it visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, and toured the West Sea Barrage, the Tower of the Juche Idea and other places.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Lao Prime Minister
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Lao Prime Minister
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Friday sent a message of sympathy to Lao Prime Minister Thongsing Thammavong as regards tropical typhoon and heavy rain that hit Laos, claiming many casualties and material losses.
					 Expressing deep sympathy and consolation to the people of the afflicted area, the message hoped that the Lao government and people would eradicate the aftermath of the natural disaster as early as possible.

articles.title: Congratulations to Vietnamese Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Vietnamese Prime Minister
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Nguyen Tan Dung on Wednesday on his reelection as prime minister of Vietnam at the First Session of the 13th National Assembly. 
					 Choe in the message wished him good heath and greater success in the work for industrialization and modernization of the country, expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop in all fields including politics, economy and culture.

articles.title: N. Hwanghae Province Suffers from Flood
articles.content:
N. Hwanghae Province Suffers from Flood
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- North Hwanghae Province, the DPRK, has suffered seriously from flood.
					 According to initial results of a survey, more than 360 hectares of cropland have been flooded in Sohung County and over 650 hectares in the province. Roads, dwelling houses and public buildings were also destroyed in the province. 
					
					 It rained more than 300mm in Sohung, Singye, Kumchon, Rinsan and Phyongsan counties from July 26 to 28.
					
					 A detailed survey is now under way and necessary measures have been taken to recover from the damage.

articles.title: Pyongyang Ready to Perform Arirang
articles.content:
Pyongyang Ready to Perform Arirang 
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" have come to an end in the DPRK.
					 A large electronic display reading Grand Gymnastic and Artistic Performance "Arirang" is seen in the main entrance of May Day Stadium, the venue of the performance, in Pyongyang.
					
					 Colorful illuminators and decoration lights newly installed around the venue add to the architectural beauty of the stadium and the landscape of the area.
					
					 The performers are now engaged in dress rehearsal at the stadium.
					
					The annual event, involving famous Korean music, dance, gymnastic and acrobatic pieces, background arts, up-to-date instruments and lighting apparatuses, is supplemented with new and modern things in content and performance.
					
					 Kim Mok Ryong, senior director of the performance, told KCNA:
					
					 A miniature of Mt. Paektu in the prologue is portrayed in a three-dimensional way, differently from before. 
					
					 The scene "My Prospering Country" is changed into "Country of Fruit Culture and Fish Farming" to represent the developing fruit and fish farming of the DPRK.
					
					 "Friendship Arirang" and some other scenes have also been revised.
					
					 The performance consists of eight chapters and nineteen scenes.
					
					 The world-famous extravaganza will provide spectators with a good knowledge of the history of the DPRK's development.

articles.title: Cooperation between DPRK, Egyptian Universities
articles.content:
Cooperation between DPRK, Egyptian Universities
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- An agreement on friendship and exchange and cooperation in education and scientific research was signed between Kim Il Sung University of the DPRK and Cairo University of Egypt on July 20.
					 It was inked by Song Ja Rip, minister of Higher Education and president of Kim Il Sung University, and Hossam Mohamed Kamel, president of Cairo University.

articles.title: DPRK's Good Results at Military World Games
articles.content:
DPRK's Good Results at Military World Games
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The Korean People's Army athletes won seven gold, two silver and three bronze medals at the 5th Military World Games.
					 An Kum Ae (women's judo 52kg) received the prize of best player at the games.
					
					 They returned home Thursday.

articles.title: Talented Girl Famous for Dancing
articles.content:
Talented Girl Famous for Dancing
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- "I saw in the naive and cheerful smile of Jin Ok the happy life of the Korean children fully cultivating their talents under the care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, as well as a bright future of Korea." This is what an editor of the Chinese CCTV said after seeing her dancing.
					Kim Jin Ok, a 10-year-old pupil of Kumsong Secondary School No.1, distinguished herself at a performance of children with gifted talents in Beijing in April.
					
					 KCNA had an interview with the girl, her parents and Kim Hye Kyong, a teacher of the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace.
					
					 Question; Can you give me your impressions of "Gifted Talents", a performance of the world's prodigies?
					
					 Kim Hye Gyong; Under-15 children from many countries presented their talents at the performance.
					
					 Kim Jin Ok participated in the performance with solo dances like "Dance with Water Jar" and "Dance with Drum." Her dancing was so amazing and fascinating that the sponsors gave her 30 more minutes, though the fixed time for each performer is less than 10 minutes.
					
					She danced to cheerful and charming Korean melodies, capturing the house.
					
					 The principal of the Conservatory of the Chinese People's Liberation Army said Kim Jin Ok was a little world star. 
					
					 The principle said, "I am a dance expert, but I admired the little girl's gifted talent. In particular, her rotating in a circle while beating a drum requires a high technique, worthy to be recorded in the Guinness Book. I think she owes her talent to the deep care of leader Kim Jong Il and his noble view of rising generation." 
					
					 Question; I think you must have paid much effort to your daughter's development.
					
					 Mother (Choe Yong Hui); At first, my daughter learnt Kayagum (Korean musical instrument). 
					
					 When she said she wanted to dance, I thought she was just going to repeat movements she learnt in kindergarten.
					
					 She could bring into full play her gifted talent and become a dance prodigy under the socialist education system of Korea.
					
					 Only her gifted talent was not enough for winning such popularity.
					
					 I am really grateful to the socialist education system.
					
					 Question; I think you father have a lot of things to speak.
					
					 Father (Kim Sun Chol); I was so glad to see my daughter when she came back after displaying the honor of the motherland.
					
					 I will work hard for the socialist motherland.
					
					 Question; Jin Ok, you toured a foreign country as a dancer of the Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Art Troupe and enjoyed great popularity at the New Year performance of schoolchildren this year and the performance of the world's prodigies. Can you tell me what you wish?
					
					 Kim Jin Ok: It is my greatest wish to dance for leader Kim Jong Il to delight him.

articles.title: New Fruit Processing Factory Built in Pyongyang
articles.content:
New Fruit Processing Factory Built in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory was built in Samsok District, Pyongyang.
					 The factory, belonging to the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, covers tens of thousands of square meters and its annual production capacity is tens of thousands of tons. It produces varieties of fruit juice, soda pop, jam, vinegar, perfume, shampoo and rinse.
					
					 Its high-tech production processes like raw material treatment, filtering, concentration, finishing and packing are monitored and controlled by computer.
					
					 The products of the factory have flavor and aroma peculiar to fruits.
					
					 When visiting the factory some time ago, General Secretary Kim Jong Il praised its employees for operating the production processes in a modern and scientific way.

articles.title: New Antirachitic for Domestic Animals Developed
articles.content:
New Antirachitic for Domestic Animals Developed
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The State Academy of Sciences has developed a new antirachitic for domestic animal and poultry.
					 The medicine is also efficacious for preventing and treating osteomalacia.
					
					 It, made with dolomite abundant in the country, is low in production cost.
					
					 The new medicine has already been applied to some farms to prevent fowls and piglets from being damaged by rachitis and osteomalacia.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Conservative Group of Fascist Suppression
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Conservative Group of Fascist Suppression
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The conservative group of south Korea is blocking social progress and democratic development on the strength of the "National Security Law." Its present reality goes to prove that the south Korean people can never expect their elementary human rights guaranteed, to say nothing of independence, democracy and reunification, as long as the NSL is allowed to remain in force. Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a by-lined article.
					 The present ruling forces in south Korea are the heinous fascist dictatorial forces keen on abusing human rights while maintaining their power on the strength of the NSL, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The conservative group has desperately blocked any move of the progressive forces for the repeal of the evil law, claiming "abolition of the NSL is premature" even before their seizure of power. No sooner had it come to power than revived the past fascist dictatorial system as evidenced by the restoration of the already defunct department which specialized in handling the cases of the violation of the NSL, etc. The south Korean fascist authorities are brutally cracking down upon even the struggle of the people from all walks of life for the guarantee of the right to existence on charges of violation of the NSL, libeling them "forces behind the action" and the like.
					
					 The present ruling forces in south Korea are shameless dictatorial maniacs getting frantic in their campaign against the DPRK under the signboard of "human rights".
					
					 Their anti-DPRK campaign over "its human rights issue" is nothing but a revelation of their traitorous attempt to cover up their serious human rights abuses, divert elsewhere the attention of the people in anti-"government" actions and realize their scenario for achieving "unification of systems," their long-harbored goal.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities persist in intensifying the fascist suppression and kicking up the anti-DPRK campaign over its "human rights issue," defying the call of the times for the abolition of the NSL, they will certainly find themselves in the dumping ground of history along with the fascist law, warns the article.

articles.title: More Facts about US Forces' Defoliant Burial Disclosed in S. Korea
articles.content:
More Facts about US Forces' Defoliant Burial Disclosed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- It has been recently disclosed that the U.S. imperialist aggression troops stationed in Waegwan, Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province of south Korea buried defoliant from other military bases beside that in their own base.
					 A retired U.S. soldier mentioned this fact at a meeting held at the "National Assemblymen's" Hall in Seoul on July 25. He was the first to disclose the defoliant burial.
					
					 According to his testimony, trucks of a U.S. air force unit carried drums containing defoliant and other unknown chemical substances to the Waegwan base two or three times per a week in six months by the end of 1978 after defoliant in the base was buried. 
					
					 Whenever the trucks arrived, the U.S. troops in Waegwan guided them to the place where they buried defoliant for the first time. Then they unloaded the drums of defoliant and buried them with bulldozers, and the number of drums amounted to hundreds in all.
					
					 Early next year when this area was covered with snow and water, there floated in the water yellow and brown bubbles. Particularly, all vegetables, cultivated at the foot of its surrounding hills, perished and birds, hares and other animals were found dead in its vicinities.
					
					 Disclosing this fact, he complained that the investigation into this case is being delayed against one's expectation.
					
					 He told that he knew nothing about opinion that the buried drums were transferred to other place afterwards.
					
					 Other retired U.S. soldiers, who accompanied him, claimed that it was a very hard thing at that time to dig out and transfer defoliant to other place. If this was true, there wouldn't be no record, they said.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression Slammed
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea on July 25 issued a commentary denouncing the authorities for their fascist suppression of the forces opposed to the construction of the Jeju naval base.
					 The police and the military authorities walked off the chief of the Kangjong Village Society and two others, arrested the chairman of the Inhabitants Measure Committee for Opposing the Jeju Naval Base and one more person, the commentary said. They also took a fascist action of demanding 14 inhabitants pay huge compensation for damage.
					
					 Such moves of the "government" are aimed to turn Jeju Island into a U.S. war outpost even infringing upon the people's vital rights, the commentary charged.
					
					 The Kangjong village is being scorched due to the authorities' repressive moves and Jeju Island is, in fact, under the state of martial law, it deplored.
					
					 This is little short of branding the people opposed to the construction of the naval base and determined to protect their land as the enemy, it held.
					
					 It demanded the authorities give up its attempt to convert the Kangjong village into a military base and immediately withdraw all the repressive armed forces from the village. If they turn down this, they will not escape the people's judgment, it warned.

articles.title: S. Korean IS Suppresses Chief Editor of Magazine Minjok 21
articles.content:
S. Korean IS Suppresses Chief Editor of Magazine Minjok 21
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Intelligence Service made a wholesale search of the house and office of the chief editor of magazine Minjok 21 for more than ten hours from the afternoon of July 24 to the dawn of the next day.
					 The IS confiscated a computer, notebook, data on his news coverage during his visit to the north and even a receipt between leaves of a notebook on the suspicion that he acted at the "Iljin Association" at the instructions of a Korean in Japan after being embraced by him.
					
					 Meanwhile, it is making an investigation into the managing editor of Minjok 21 by linking him with the so-called "case of the Iljin Association" for the mere reason that he conducted media activities in touch with Chongryon (the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan) during the preceding regime.
					
					 What is deplorable is the present reality of south Korea in which legitimate and open media activities are branded as "pro-communist acts of benefiting the enemy" and charges are being fabricated, the chief editor said, adding he would prove his innocence in the course of investigation.
					
					 The editorial board of Minjok 21 declared the recent action of the IS as little short of a premeditatedly and carefully worked out investigation as it was a grave provocation.

articles.title: Solidarity with DPRK Expressed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Solidarity with DPRK Expressed in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between July 18 and 23 to mark the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and the month of international solidarity with them.
					 They included meetings in Switzerland and Germany and a film show in Malaysia.
					
					 The chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee said that under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung the heroic Korean People's Army and the people of the DPRK won a brilliant victory in the Fatherland Liberation War against the aggression by the U.S. imperialists and their followers.
					
					 The Korean people's victory in the war was a historic event that brought about the beginning of decline for the U.S. imperialists, who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world, and powerfully encouraged the world progressive people in the anti-imperialist national liberation struggle, he said.
					
					 The chief of the Franken Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Germany referred to the feats of the President for the victory in the war and to the validity and invincible might of the Songun politics pursued by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Messages of greeting and solidarity to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings in Switzerland and Germany. 
					
					 Meanwhile, a film show was held at the Joint Institute for Nuclear Research of Russia on July 20 to commemorate the 17th anniversary of demise of the President.

articles.title: War Victory Day of Korean People Marked in Finland and India
articles.content:
War Victory Day of Korean People Marked in Finland and India
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Officials of Finland and India issued statements on July 22 on the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The Korean War was a heroic and just war of the Korean people who beat back the aggression by the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces, Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, said, and went on:
					
					  The world progressive people are praising the Korean people as the heroic people who defeated the U.S. for the first time in the world.
					
					  President Kim Il Sung not only led the Fatherland Liberation War to victory but wisely led the postwar rehabilitation and construction and thus successfully built the popular socialist system in a brief span of time.
					
					 The DPRK has turned into a powerful state thanks to the Songun politics of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					  We fully approve of his Songun politics and extend firm solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					  Wipin Gupta, chairman of the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India, said the Korean people won the victory in the war and thus frustrated the attempt of the U.S. to put the world under its control with the Korean Peninsula as a springboard and defended the peace and security of the world.
					
					 He denounced the U.S. for committing ceaseless military provocations against the DPRK by instigating the south Korean puppet clique, far from drawing a serious lesson from the defeat it suffered in the Korean war.

articles.title: War Victory Day of DPRK Celebrated by Brazilian Organization
articles.content:
War Victory Day of DPRK Celebrated by Brazilian Organization
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK on July 21 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "DPRK, July 27, day of victory" on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The victory of the Korean people in the past Fatherland Liberation War occupies a distinguished place in the history of the DPRK, the homepage said in its article.
					
					 The U.S. which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world mobilized huge armed forces and squandered unprecedentedly big military expenditure in the Korean War but it recorded its first defeat in history, it noted.
					
					 There went on the confrontation between the DPRK and the U.S. after the Korean War but all the cases ended in the U.S. defeat, in other words, in the victory of the Korean people, it said.
					
					 The historic meaning of July 27, the war victory day of the Korean people, was put in bold relief amid their steady victories in confrontation with the U.S., it noted, adding: July 27 will shine long as the day of the Korean people's victory.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepali Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepali Paper
Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The Nepali newspaper Charcha on July 25 carried the third part of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification."
					 The work, published on August 4, 1997, deals with the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung for national reunification and formulates the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme for great national unity and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification. It also clarifies the tasks and ways for achieving national reunification on the basis of them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Disseminated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Disseminated Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy" has been studied and disseminated in more than 100 countries and regions.
					 The work, published on July 26, 1996, clarifies the idea that the Juche philosophy is an original philosophy evolved and systematized with principles peculiar to it and a revolutionary and popular philosophy truly serving the popular masses' struggle for independence.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for studying and explaining the Juche philosophy in conformity with the Workers' Party of Korea's intention and fully applying it in the revolutionary practice.
					
					 The full text or gist of the work were reported by the Thai paper Xing San Daily, the Egyptian paper Al-Misaiya, the Nigerian paper New Nigerian, the Bulgarian paper Narodna Tribuna, Equatorial Guinean radio and many other media.
					
					 The work was also carried in bulletins and posted on Internet homepages by Juche idea study organizations in different countries and regions. Among them were the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Political parties, organizations and press organs of over 70 countries brought out the work in pamphlet and e-book. They included the Unified Communist Party of Italy, the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People, the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, the Cuba Academia Publishing House, the Lao State Publishing House, the National Education Publishing House of Guinea and the Canta Clara Publishing House of Venezuela.
					
					 Political parties, organizations and personages in various countries and regions made public statements in praise of the undying feats of Kim Jong Il who has clearly showed the road ahead of the times through his distinguished and energetic ideo-theoretical activities.
					
					 Seminars, lectures, explanation meetings and reading sessions on the work were held by political parties and organizations, including the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development, the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea, the Group for the Study of the Progressive Ideas of South Africa and the Revolutionary Alternative Party of Dominica.

articles.title: Training of Able Teachers Called for in China
articles.content:
Training of Able Teachers Called for in China
 Beijing, July 28 (KCNA) -- The Chinese education minister on July 22 called for training able teachers as required by a new situation.
					 Addressing a national meeting held in Beijing, he underlined the need to pay much effort to training teachers of ability urgently and establishing a system for training capable educationists.

articles.title: China Refits Aircraft Carrier for Research, Training
articles.content:
China Refits Aircraft Carrier for Research, Training
 Beijing, July 28 (KCNA) -- China is refitting an aircraft carrier for the purpose of scientific research, experiments and training, said a spokesman for China's Defense Ministry at a press conference on Wednesday. 
					 Referring to groundless news reports concerning China's future aircraft carrier, he said that overestimating or underestimating its role is not correct. 
					
					 The research and training project fully embodies the capability of China's defense technology and will promote the modernization of the People's Liberation Army, the spokesman added.

articles.title: Lecture Meeting for Party Officials Held in Beijing
articles.content:
Lecture Meeting for Party Officials Held in Beijing
 Beijing, July 28 (KCNA) -- A lecture meeting was held in Beijing on July 22 on the theme of "Let us devote sincerity to the party". 
					 Ten officials from the ministries of Foreign Affaires, Agriculture and Culture and other organs gave lectures. 
					
					 Attending the meeting were 400 party officials of national institutions.

articles.title: 2012 to Be Declared Year of Russian History
articles.content:
2012 to Be Declared Year of Russian History
 Moscow, July 28 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev said on July 22 that the year 2012 marking the 1150th anniversary of the Russian state will be declared a year of the Russian history. 
					 He made the remark at a preparatory meeting for the celebration of the anniversary.

articles.title: Russia Calls for Confidence Building in MD Project
articles.content:
Russia Calls for Confidence Building in MD Project 
 Moscow, July 28 (KCNA) -- Dmitri Rogozin, Russian permanent representative to NATO, at a recent press conference, called for building confidence in establishing the missile defense (MD) system in Europe.
					 He said that it is impossible to cooperate with each other in the project without mutual confidence, and vice versa. 
					
					 Russia wants to become a practical partner in the project, not a passive onlooker to U.S. acts like a tourist.

articles.title: Japan's Kagoshima Gov. Opposes Transfer of US Drills without Local Approval
articles.content:
Japan's Kagoshima Gov. Opposes Transfer of U.S. Drills without Local Approval
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The governor of Kagoshima Prefecture of Japan on July 25 strongly protested the authorities' unilateral behavior.
					 The governor lodged a protest against the central government bypassing the local government without adequate explanations to it in designating Mage Island in the prefecture as a candidate site for the relocation of U.S. carrier-borne aircraft-landing drills in an accord with the United States.
					
					 The central government should respect the locals' wishes more than anything, he noted.

articles.title: Strong Earthquake Jolts Northeastern Japan
articles.content:
Strong Earthquake Jolts Northeastern Japan
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The magnitude 6.2-quake struck northeastern Japan Monday and was centered 94 kilometers east of Fukushima Prefecture.

articles.title: Cambodian PM Denounces US False Propaganda
articles.content:
Cambodian PM Denounces US False Propaganda
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Cambodia's Prime Minister Hun Sen on July 22 denounced two U.S.-funded radio stations for what he described as inaccurate and unfair reports.
					 Voice of America and Radio Free Asia are broadcasting reports critical of the Cambodian government over the "human rights and corruption" issues. Hun Sen said that reports broadcast in the Cambodian language by Voice of America and Radio Free Asia were groundless.

articles.title: Iraq Ignores US Sanctions against Iran: Minister
articles.content:
Iraq Ignores U.S. Sanctions against Iran: Minister
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The Iraqi oil minister, Abdul Kareem Luaiby, said his country ignores the U.S.-imposed sanctions against Iran.
					 Speaking to Iran's official news agency on July 25, the minister said the U.S.-imposed sanctions against Iran have nothing to do with Iran-Iraq relations.
					
					 The Iraqi government is adopting independent policies and trying to boost cooperation with all countries in the world.

articles.title: PLO Rejects Israeli Threat
articles.content:
PLO Rejects Israeli Threat
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Saeb Erekat, member of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization, resolutely rejected Israel's threat when interviewed on July 25.
					 The Israeli authorities had threatened to call off Oslo peace accords signed between Palestine and Israel. As Israel had already annulled it, there is no need for threats to call it off, he said.
					
					 Israeli threats won't influence the Palestinian political and diplomatic stances, he stressed.

articles.title: Cooperation among Asian Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Asian Countries
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Iran, Syria and other countries on July 25 signed a contract for the transit of Iranian natural gas from the country's South Pars gas field to Europe.
					 Yemen and India on July 22 signed several security cooperation agreements on combating terrorism and piracy.

articles.title: Kazakh President Warns of Ultra-religionists
articles.content:
Kazakh President Warns of Ultra-religionists 
 Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- Kazakh President Nursultan Nazarbayev called for dealing a heavy blow to ultra-religionists.
					 Addressing a meeting on July 22, he said that all extreme religious activities like disturbing the constitutional order and threatening citizens' life should be handled without mercy. 
					
					 He called upon the central and local governments to intensify information activities for preventing crimes and supervising religious organizations in abiding by order and law.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige la Fabrica 11 de Mayo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige la Fabrica 11 de Mayo 
　Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Fabrica 11 de Mayo. 
					　Esta moderna base desarrolla y produce los productos electronicos de distintos tipos incluso los televisores de pantalla de liquido cristal, necesarios en la vida cultural del pueblo. 
					
					　El Dirigente recorrio el taller de ajuste de aparatos electronicos y otros lugares, donde hizo conocimiento detallado de la modernizacion y la gestion de la fabrica. 
					
					　Al enterarse de que la fabrica acondiciono un nuevo proceso productivo de TV de pantalla de liquido cristal con la capacidad anual de fabricar cientos de miles de TV y asento una firme base para producir en gran cantidad los TV de diversos tamanos, evaluo de altos el temperamento de creacion y el fervor patriotico de los cientificos, tecnicos y obreros de la fabrica. 
					
					　Al ver con atencion los equipos recien desarrollados por los cientificos y tecnicos, volvio a apreciar que es un exito loable que hayan preparado la firme garantia cientifica y tecnica para contribuir al desarrollo economico incluso la industria electronica. 
					
					　La fabrica pudo desarrollar nuevos productos electronicos de diversas variedades y de buen funcionamiento, porque los funcionarios, cientificos y tecnicos, con los pies en la tierra patria y la mirada hacia el mundo, arden en deseo de contribuir a la causa de construccion del Estado prospero con los exitos de la investigacion cientifica, senalo y anadio que este exito orgulloso manifiesta plenamente la justeza y la vitalidad de la politica de nuestro partido de mantener la ciencia y tecnica como linea de vida de la construccion de la potencia economica.  
					
					　El Dirigente presento las tareas programaticas que incumben a la fabrica. 
					
					　La tarea importante es aumentar vertiginosamente la produccion de los productos electronicos y los articulos de uso cultural como TV de pantalla de liquido cristal, de acuerdo con la demanda de la epoca de economia basada en intelectualidad y las necesidades de los habitantes, indico. 
					
					　Lo mas importante es aumentar la calidad de todos los productos de la fabrica y rebajar el costo de produccion mediante la investigacion cientifica, de manera que los productos de la fabrica pudieran ganar buena reputacion publica y se registrara un nuevo cambio en la administracion empresarial de la fabrica, enseno. 
					
					　Para traer un nuevo viraje en el desarrollo y la produccion de los productos electronicos de acuerdo con la demanda de nuevo siglo es preciso facilitar suficientes condiciones necesarias a la investigacion cientifica y la produccion y prestar profunda atencion a la vida de los cientificos y tecnicos, apunto.
					
					　El Dirigente se fotografio junto a los empleados de la Fabrica. 
					
					　Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, y otros funcionarios directivos del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Informacion de direccion de la zona especial de turismo al monte Kumgang
articles.content:
Informacion de direccion de la zona especial de turismo al monte Kumgang
　Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ATCC) -- Con respecto a que no se puede abrir las negociaciones con los empresarios surcoreanos debido a las injustas acciones obstaculizadoras de las autoridades surcoreanas aunque esta por vencer la fecha limite, la Direccion de la Zona Especial del Turismo Internacional al Monte Kumgang de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 29 la siguiente informacion: 
					　Como ya trascendidos, dado que ha sido suspendido durante 3 anos el turismo al monte Kumgang por culpa de las autoridades surcoreanas, hemos promulgado la ley de la zona especial del turismo internacional al monte Kumgang de la RPDC. En virtud de esa ley, demandamos a los empresarios surcoreanos registrar de nuevo sus negocios y propiedades y participar en el turismo internacional o ajustar sus bienes inmuebles y les ofrecimos varias veces la oportunidad de negociar con nuestra parte. 
					
					　Esta medida fraternal para proteger el derecho sobre propiedades y los intereses de las empresas surcoreanas es una muestra de sinceridad y magnanimidad de nuestra parte. 
					
					　Sin embargo, las autoridades surcoreanas obstaculizaron hasta el final las negociaciones con los empresarios civiles surcoreanos para el ajuste de los bienes, y hace pocos dias, propusieron las conversaciones de trabajo entre las autoridades Norte-Sur con el fin de excluir de las negociaciones a los empresarios civiles. 
					
					　Nuestra parte notifico la posicion de aceptarlas a condicion de que las autoridades surcoreanas acudan junto con los empresarios civiles para el ajuste de bienes. 
					
					　No obstante, las autoridades surcoreanas inducen en error la opinion publica diciendo que nuestra parte nego las conversaciones de trabajo entre autoridades y hasta ahora a punto de vencer la fecha limite, que hemos definido y avisado a ellas, no vienen a negociar ni envian a los empresarios surcoreanos. 
					
					　El hecho muestra que la "proteccion del derecho sobre las propiedades" de que hablaban las autoridades surcoreanas es una palabra vana y que su iniciativa de las conversaciones de trabajo entre autoridades no pasa de ser una artimana para impedir el ajuste de bienes y frustrar el turismo internacional y la reanudacion del turismo auspiciado por la parte Sur. 
					
					  Ya hemos declarado que si la parte Sur no acepta hasta el 29 de julio las negociaciones para el ajuste de bienes, nos veremos obligados a la disposicion legal de los bienes de la parte surena, en virtud de la ley de la RPDC. 
					
					　Por lo tanto, la Direccion de la Zona Especial del Turismo Internacional al Monte Kumgang declara que desde hoy, pasara a la disposicion legal de todos los bienes inmuebles y otras propiedades de la parte Sur en esta zona. 
					
					　Hemos transmitido hoy desde el monte Kumgang la resolucion sobre el respecto a las empresas surcoreanas correspondientes, por conducto del Grupo Hyundai, y lo hicimos tambien a las autoridades surcoreanas por via de Phanmunjom. 
					
					　El tiempo de tramitacion de tal disposicion legal es de 3 semanas en que los interesados surcoreanos deben asistir a este proceso. 
					
					　Para ofrecerles la oportunidad de optar por participar en el turismo internacional, alquilar, traspasar o vender, prolongaremos, si es necesario, la moratoria de disposicion legal. 
					
					　Los empresarios, que tienen dificultades para  viajar al monte Kumgang por la obstruccion de las autoridades, pueden encomendar el ajuste de bienes a una tercera persona, contactarse con nuestra parte en un tercer lugar para discutir el problema de registro y disposicion o usar otros metodos. 
					
					　En el caso de las empresas que no asistan a la disposicion legal dentro de tres semanas, lo tomaremos como la renuncia total al derecho sobre sus propiedades en el monte Kumgang y las dispondremos en estricto apego a la ley de la zona especial del turismo internacional al mismo monte. 
					
					　Los bienes inmuebles dispuestos legalmente se utilizaran en el turismo internacional segun el procedimiento legal de nuestra parte. 
					
					　La responsabilidad de esta situacion recae enteramente sobre las autoridades surcoreanas. 
					
					　La presente medida de la RPDC conviene completamente a la ley de la RPDC y a las costumbres internacionales, por lo tanto, la parte Sur no puede apelar mas sobre ella.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre varios lugares de construccion
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre varios lugares de construccion 
　Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ATCC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim analizo sobre el terreno los dias 26 y 27 los lugares de construccion del Parque Folclorico de Pyongyang y de la villa de Taekwon-Do y la sede de exhibicion de los articulos de consumo popular 3 de Agosto de la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					　Choe convoco una reunion de consulta tras recorrerlos.
					
					　Se discutieron en la reunion los asuntos sobre las medidas que se presentan en levantar cualitativamente durante el corto tiempo edificios que daran a conocer la orgullosa tradicion de la nacion coreana que cuenta con la larga historia, la cultura, la inteligencia y la habilidad de 5 milenios.
					
					　Por otra parte, Choe recorrio los productos de industria ligera exhibidos en la sede de la exhibicion de los articulos del consumo popular 3 de Agosto de la ciudad de Pyongyang, que tiene lugar en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones.
					
					　En el terreno, el premier coreano subrayo que al materializar cabalmente la orientacion del partido de incrementar decisivamente la produccion de articulos de consumo popular, las entidades concernientes deben producir mucho las mercancias de buena calidad convenientes al gusto de los consumidores y asi hacer gran aporte al mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre cancilleres de Corea y Singapur
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre cancilleres de Corea y Singapur
　Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 27 en Singapur las conversaciones entre el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun y su homologo singapurense K. Shanmugam.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion y el embajador coreano en Singapur y por la otra singapurense el secretario permanente del ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y otros relacionados.
					
					  Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el problema de desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					  Ese dia, el canciller singapurense ofrecio un banquete en honor de la delegacion coreana.

articles.title: Terminados preparativos de la funcion "Arirang" en Corea
articles.content:
Terminados preparativos de la funcion "Arirang" en Corea 
　Pyongyang, 29 de julio (ATCC) -- Terminaron en Corea los preparativos de la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang".
					　En la entrada frontal del capitalino Estadio Primero de Mayo, sede de la funcion, fue colocado el letrero de gran tamano decorado con lamparillas electricas: "La funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva Arirang".
					
					　Los bombillos multicolores y las lamparas de adorno de varios tipos, instalados en el contorno del Estadio, resaltan la original belleza arquitectonica y el paisaje maravilloso de este lugar.
					
					　Ahora, todos los ejecutantes de la funcion realizan ahi ejercicios combinados adiestrando sus movimientos.
					
					　En la presente edicion de "Arirang" se introduciran las famosas canciones coreanas, las hermosas danzas folcloricas, la gimnasia artistica, la acrobacia, la escenografia y los modernos aparatos y medios de iluminacion.
					
					　El director general de la funcion Kim Mok Ryong (62 anos de edad) anuncio que la maqueta del monte Paektu, que aparece en el prologo, se mostrara esta vez de modo tridimensional, y prosiguio:
					
					　El programa llamado antes "Mi pais en prosperidad" fue sustituido por el "Pais de fruticultura y piscicultura" y mostrara vividamente el aspecto de desarrollo de estas labores en Corea.
					
					　Ademas, fueron enmendadas y complementadas las piezas como "Arirang de Amistad".
					
					　La funcion consta de 8 capitulos como la "Arirang del Songun" y la "Arirang de Felicidad" y de 19 escenas.
					
					　Esta obra maestra de talla mundial dara a entender de modo emocionante a los espectadores la historia de cambios seculares y de creaciones de Corea.
